detaileddescription.para:
Mode of modeling.
Inverse: image to input param
AutoI: image to image
AutoS: scalar to scalar

briefdescription.para: The current mode of modeling.
Whether image output data have been loaded.
Whether scalar output data have been loaded.
Whether simulation input data have been loaded.
The number of samples.
The linearized size of an image.
The linearized size of scalar outputs.
The linearized size of inputs.
image normalization mode
image width
image height
List of jag output images.
List of jag scalar outputs.
List of jag input.
The smallest pixel value in image data (useful for normalization or visualization)
The largest pixel value in image data (useful for normalization or visualization)
Set the modeling mode: Inverse, AutoI, or AutoS.
Set normalization mode: 0 = none, 1 = dataset-wise, 2 = image-wise.
Set the image dimension.
Load data and do data reader's chores.
Show the description.
Return the number of samples.
Return the linearized size of an image.
Return the linearized size of scalar outputs.
Return the linearized size of inputs.
Get the linearized size (i.e. number of elements) in a sample.
Get the linearized size (i.e. number of elements) in a response.
Get the dimensions of the data.
Return the pointer to the raw image data.
Return the image data as a 1-D vector of lbann::DataType.
Return the pointer to the raw scalar data.
Return the scalar values of the i-th sample.
Return the pointer to the raw input data.
Return the input values of the simulation correspoding to the i-th sample.

memberdef.argsstring: (Mat &pixels, const std::string filename, bool do_scale=true) override
memberdef.name: save_image

detaileddescription.para: Save pixels to an image. The implementing data reader is responsible for handling format detection, conversion, etc.

memberdef.argsstring: (Mat &X, int data_id, int mb_idx, int tid) override
memberdef.name: fetch_datum

detaileddescription.para:
Fetch a single sample into a matrix.
X
The matrix to load data into.
data_id
The index of the datum to fetch.
mb_idx
The index within the mini-batch.

memberdef.argsstring: (Mat &Y, int data_id, int mb_idx, int tid) override
memberdef.name: fetch_response

detaileddescription.para:
Fetch a single response into a matrix.
Y
The matrix to load data into.
data_id
The index of the datum to fetch.
mb_idx
The index within the mini-batch.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string image_file, const std::string scalar_file, const std::string input_file, const size_t first_n=0u)
memberdef.name: load

detaileddescription.para: Load the data in the numpy format file. Use only first_n available samples if specified.

briefdescription.para: Check the dimensions of loaded data.

detaileddescription.para: Normalize image data to [0 1] scale once after loading based on the mode 0 (none): no normalization 1 (dataset-wise): map the min/max of all the pixels in image data to 0/1 2 (image-wise): map the min/max of all the pixels in current image to 0/1

briefdescription.para: Set the linearized size of an image.
Set the linearized size of scalar outputs.
Return the linearized size of inputs.
Return the maximum element of all the images.
Return the minimum element of all the images.

detaileddescription.para: Loads the pairs of JAG simulation inputs and results
